brose.name: Gary Brose
brose.summary: Ballard entrepreneur who says city has waged war on cars by remaking roads for buses and bikes. Says small businesses are too burdened with taxes and regulations.

carlisle.name: Casey Carlisle
carlisle.summary: Libertarian with military background. Says city leaders have been fiscally irresponsible and other candidates are Ed Murray clones.

cato.name: Tiniell Cato
cato.summary: Grant-writing and business consultant. Says government discriminates against people based on race and income.

durkan.name: Jenny Durkan
durkan.summary: Appointed by President Barack Obama, she was the first openly gay U.S. attorney. Has support from old-guard Democrats and business community.

farrell.name: Jessyn Farrell
farrell.summary: Urbanist who resigned from a statehouse seat to focus on her mayoral campaign. Emphasizing her legislative experience and reaching out to other working parents.

gunn.name: Thom Gunn
gunn.summary: Writer and former Whidbey Island restaurant owner who was once president of the Associated Students of the University of Washington.

harris.name: Michael Harris
harris.summary: Video journalist and wildlife conservationist who ran a trade group for whale-watching businesses. Says city politics have veered too far left.

hamilton.name: Greg Hamilton
hamilton.summary: Owner of a sustainable-agriculture company who served in the military. Says city’s culture is under threat from special interests and identity politics.

hasegawa.name: Bob Hasegawa
hasegawa.summary: State senator from Beacon Hill is an old-school labor leader who came up through the Teamsters. Says a municipal bank would help with many urban problems.

jones.name: Lewis A. Jones
jones.summary: Ballard Republican and former commercial fisherman with a tree-topping and lawn-mowing business. Has concerns about health effects of cellphones and says women should be trained to use firearms for safety.

kane.name: Dave Kane
kane.summary: Belltown resident and programmer who customized a DeLorean DMC-12 to look like the car from the “Back to the Future” movies.

lever.name: Harley Lever
lever.summary: Founder of Safe Seattle, a group of residents and business owners with concerns about street homelessness in neighborhoods. Says he’d use technology to improve government.

martin.name: Mary J. Martin
martin.summary: Socialist Workers Party candidate who also ran for governor in 2012 and 2016 and for mayor in 2013. Longtime factory worker.

mcginn.name: Mike McGinn
mcginn.summary: Former mayor unseated in 2013 by Ed Murray. Says he’d review budget, tax big businesses, focus on basics and try to speed up the construction of light rail.

moon.name: Cary Moon
moon.summary: Urban planner who led opposition to the Alaskan Way Viaduct replacement tunnel. Calling for a crackdown on real-estate speculators, and helping to fund her own campaign.

norton.name: James W. Norton Jr.
norton.summary: Seattle police officer who says there should be more dialogue between cops and community members. Former veterinary technician and owner of a dog-walking business.

oberto.name: Larry Oberto
oberto.summary: Member of Seattle’s Oberto Sausage Company family who’s served as sports-marketing director for the company. Has been involved in hydroplane and car racing.

oliver.name: Nikkita Oliver
oliver.summary: Educator, attorney, artist and activist. Says she’d fight displacement, halt property-tax hikes and be voice for poor people, young people and people of color.

roberts.name: Jason Roberts
roberts.summary: Business owner and consultant. Advocates free rehabilitation services for people struggling with drug addiction.

tsimerman.name: Alex Tsimerman
tsimerman.summary: Frequent candidate who regularly delivers profane testimony at City Council meetings and rails against fascism.

whiteman.name: Keith J. Whiteman
whiteman.summary: Rock drummer who says he’d listen to experts. Says he’d ban the Confederate flag and tax big businesses.
